page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The southern edge of the City of Plymouth,bordered by the sea.An area that includes The Hoe,Millbay Docks,and Stonehouse,as well as Cremyll and Mount Edgcumbe on the west bank of the River Tamar in south east Cornwall.It is an area high in tourist facilities with cross channel ferries leaving for Roscoff in Brittany,France and Santander in northern Spain.The area includes historical buildings such as Mount Edgcumbe House,Smeaton's Tower and the Royal Victualling Yard,and Stonehouse Barracks,the home of 42 marine commando unit.
